enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Thursday, the third day of January, two thousand and thirteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the National Peace Officers’ Memorial Service.

header.#text: Use of the Capitol Grounds for National Peace Officers’ Memorial Service

term.#tail: ) shall be permitted to sponsor a public event, the 32nd Annual National Peace Officers’ Memorial Service (in this resolution referred to as the
), on the Capitol Grounds, in order to honor the law enforcement officers who died in the line of duty during 2012.

text.#text: The Grand Lodge of the Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary (in this resolution referred to as the

free of admission charge and open to the public; and

The sponsor shall assume full responsibility for all expenses and liabilities incident to all activities associated with the event.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the sponsor is authorized to erect upon the Capitol Grounds such stage, sound amplification devices, and other related structures and equipment, as may be required for the event.
